title: In Greenland, Trump's approach turns the population against the US
subhead: Shocked by the US president's threats to seize the Inuit island, residents of Greenland are voicing their anger in Nuuk, the capital, on Saturday. In just a few weeks, the appeal once held by the American dream has vanished.

title: Minneapolis emerges as new epicenter of resistance to Trump: 'ICE wasn't expecting that'
Kais Saied and Tunisia's downfall
Gaza 'board of peace' takes shape amid criticism
subhead: The White House has named the first executive body in charge of overseeing the second phase of the fragile US-backed peace plan for the war-torn Palestinian enclave, amid the threat of deadlock.

title: French police still hope to recover jewelry stolen in Louvre heist, top prosecutor says
subhead: Paris prosecutor Laure Beccuau said this week the main objective of investigations into last October's theft at the Louvre museum in Paris was still to recovery the stolen treasures, though she indicted there were no current leads as to where they may be.

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear white in winter?
subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

title: Mercosur-EU: What the trade deal contains for the agriculture, minerals and industrial sectors
subhead: Despite the controversy, the free trade agreement between the EU and four countries in the Mercosur trade bloc will have a limited economic impact. Its implementation is set to be very gradual, while containing several safeguards.

Yann Le Cun: 'Why I'm leaving Meta to launch my own AI start-up'
subhead: The former head of artificial intelligence research at Meta explains his decision to start a new company focused on the physical world, citing strategic differences with the American tech giant and predicting a 'third AI revolution' in the coming years.

title: How a uranium supply coveted by Russia ended up in limbo in Niger
subhead: A convoy of trucks loaded with 1,000 metric tons of uranium concentrate left the Arlit mine in Niger on November 27. The shipment was supposed to reach the port of Lomé, Togo, for transfer to a Russian bulk carrier, according to French government sources. Instead, it got stuck at Niamey airport.

title: Venezuela two weeks after Maduro's abduction: 'I was scared, then I cried with joy. Now, I'm scared again'
subhead: Following the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, who has led Venezuela since 2013, Le Monde collected accounts from residents of Caracas and its suburbs.
